newsitem.title: INDONESIA: PERTAMINA SHUTS 100,000 BPD CILACAP REFINERY.
newsitem.headline: PERTAMINA SHUTS 100,000 BPD CILACAP REFINERY.

text.p: Indonesian state oil company Pertamina has shut its 100,000 barrels per day Cilacap refinery for 35 days for maintenance, a company source said on Wednesday.
"We have shut the 100,000 bpd crude distillation unit at the refinery from Tuesday for maintenance," the source told Reuters.
"The turnaround is scheduled for 35 days," the source said.
The source gave no other details.
Pertamina has two refineries in Cilacap in central Java. The other refinery has a capacity of 200,000 bpd.
"The 200,000 bpd refinery is working fine," the source said.
